applyRuleModal.title: Rules that can be applied to the following expenses

questionnaire.hobby_extra_income: Hobby, Odd Jobs, and Extra Incomes

income.upload: Drag a file or click to browse

item1.title: Have children aged 11 years or younger

content.description: Parents can deduct expenses related to childcare, such as daycare (barnehage) or after-school programs (SFO/AKS), for children under 12 years of age. The deduction is up to NOK 25,000 for the first child and an additional NOK 15,000 per additional child under 12.

questions.howManyChildren: How many children do you have under the age of 12?

item2.title: I have children aged 12 or older with special care needs

content.description: Parents can deduct expenses related to childcare, such as daycare (barnehage) or after-school programs (SFO/AKS), for children under 12 years of age.

questions.specialCareNeeds: Do you have children with needs for special care?

content.description: Single parents now receive financial support through other mechanisms, such as:

details.extendedChildBenefitDesc: Single parents receive additional child benefits.
details.childcareDeductionsDesc: Deduct costs for day care and after-school programs.
details.commutingDeductionsDesc: For extra travel costs related to children, such as drop-offs.

item1.description: The deduction rate for loan interest is 22% of the interest paid in the tax year.

item2.description: Refinancing costs, such as fees and charges, are deductible alongside interest. The same 22% rate applies.

item3.description: Ensure the ownership percentage is documented, typically in the loan agreement.

item4.description: Young peopleâ€™s housing savings (BSU) is for people under 34 years of age. You can save up to NOK 27,500 per year. Then you get a tax deduction of NOK 2,750 (10 percent).

item5.description: Gains and losses on shares are taxable for the amount that exceeds the deductible risk-free return. Losses on sale of shares are deductible.

contentDonation.cardDescription: If you have given a monetary donation of at least NOK 500 to a voluntary organisation and/or religious or belief-based community, you can get a deduction for this.

item1.title: Have income or wealth in another country than Norway and pay tax in the other country

content.description: You must declare all your foreign income and wealth in the Norwegian tax return. This applies regardless of whether youâ€™ve paid tax abroad or the income/wealth is tax free in the country in question.

fields.norwayTaxRate: Norway tax rate on this income

section1.description: You can deduct related expenses such as part of your mortgage interest, electricity, insurance, and maintenance costs based on the proportion of the property rented out.

section2.description: Expenses: Include property maintenance, repairs, insurance, and a portion of mortgage interest. If the property is used solely for renting, you may be able to deduct 100% of the relevant expenses.

section3.description: If the property has been your primary residence for at least 12 of the last 24 months before the sale, the capital gains from the sale are tax-free.
section3.primaryResidence: Was the property your primary residence for at least 12 of the last 24 months?

proprietorship.title: I have a sole proprietorship
proprietorship.description: Proprietorship expense = Operating Expenses + Depreciation + Other Deductions Report income and expenses in the RF-1030 or RF-1175 forms.

sell_goods_or_services.title: Sell goods or services, blog/influencer, practice e-sports (gaming), breed animals on a small scale
sell_goods_or_services.description: Only the portion exceeding the standard commuting deduction threshold (37 km/day) is deductible. Keep records of all expenses.

received_salary.title: I have received salary from odd jobs and services
received_salary.description: Odd job income qualifies for the minimum deduction (45% of your total income, capped at NOK 104,450 for 2023).

received_salary_threshold: Received salary from odd jobs and services exceeding NOK 6000?

contentwork.home_to_work_comprehension: The return distance between home and work is more than 37 kilometers.
contentwork.road_toll_expenses: Have expenses for road toll or ferry when travelling between your home and workplace
contentwork.stay_away_over_night: I Stay away from home overnight because of work
contentwork.went_to_school_last_year: I went to school last year
contentwork.living_in_norway: Living in Norway only in part of a year
contentwork.spent_183_days_in_norway: Have you spent more than 183 days in Norway in the last 12 months?
contentwork.documented_costs_for_thesis: Documented Costs for Thesis Printing, Travel, and Defense Ceremony
contentwork.separate_room_home_office: Have a separate room in your house used only as your home office
